intro: Cyrtandra × deorsa, commonly known as the hybrid Cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant is a hybrid between Cyrtandra cuneata and Cyrtandra pedata, exhibiting traits from both parent species. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories on the islands of Hawaii. Due to its limited distribution and unique genetic makeup, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
